ModelInfo.maxNewToken: Maximum number of newly generated tokens

ChannelSettingsWindow.title: Settings
ChannelSettingsWindow.lmsGatedSettingsDescription: Restrict access to course content based on the course ID of the respective learning management system (LMS).

ChatSettingsWindow.title: Settings
ChatSettingsWindow.generalDescription: The following settings configure the context involved for prompting the large language model. If no option is selected the model will rely on it´s training data (world knowledge).
ChatSettingsWindow.generalDescriptionChannel: The following settings configure the context involved for prompting the large language model. If no option is selected the model will rely on it´s training data (world knowledge).
ChatSettingsWindow.switchContextDescription: Use best matching text sections of the transcript and best matching slides text for the prompt context to lower hallucinations.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchCitationDescription: Instruct the large language model to cite the corresponding provided text sections of context mode during generation. This enables to interact with the large language model answers by clicking on the citations and display the corresponding text section or slide. The user is able to crosscheck the popup citation and the original answer to detect hallucinations.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchChannelContextDescription: Use the most appropriate media text chunks for the prompt context to engage with the user about relevant media and its content.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchChannelCitationDescription: Uses the appropriately provided text chunks of the media context mode and instructs the large language model to quote them during generation. This makes it possible to interact with the responses of the large language model by clicking on the quotes and thereby marking the corresponding medium in the channel view.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchSelectedContextDescription: Uses a self-selected section from the transcript as context. The section must first be marked with the mouse in the transcription under the video. All other contexts are discarded, therefore only the selected context should appear if the stack button is clicked.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchVisionDescription: Press the key [ in the input field to use the current slide as the image input for the Vision Large Language Model to interact with the slide material. This allows, e.g. to ask a question about a drawn circuit on the current slide.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchVisionSurroundingSlidesDescription: Use the previous and next slides in addition to the specified slide as image input for the Vision Large Language Model.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchVisionSnapshotDescription: Use a video snapshot as image input for the Vision Large Language Model to interact with the video material. For example, you can ask a question about a whiteboard calculation written live in the video.
ChatSettingsWindow.actDescription: The following settings change the way you interact with the large language model.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchTutorDescription: The large language model is instructed to act as a learning tutor. This leads to several dialog steps to find solutions for queries with the large language model.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchReasoningDescription: The large language model is instructed to think about the given prompt for a long time. It thinks about the correct solution and looks at the solution from several angles in several thinking iterations. This leads to long response times! This mode is good for solving tasks that require complex thought processes. For example, it is good for solving math problems.
ChatSettingsWindow.switchTranslationDescription: Translates the chat window text input into English. The big language model’s answer is translated back from English to German to display the final answer in the chat window. This mode can produce different results because most large language models have been trained with a larger amount of English text data. You can use the translation button on each response to see the original English answer.

EditChapter.heading: Questions on the topic
EditChapter.instructions:
Select a difficulty level to see the corresponding questions. There is at least one question for each difficulty level.
You can add questions via the Large Language Model (LLM) by activating the switch on the right or manually if the switch is inactive.
Please use the + button to add a question using your selected option.
EditChapter.questionsTitle: Questions on the respective difficulty level
EditChapter.question: Question

EditQuestion.explanationValidation: Explanation must be at least 5 characters long.
